subject: Career
title: Negotiating a Raise vs. a New Offer
description: A quick win: understand Negotiating a Raise vs. a New Offer.

hook.text: Asking your current boss for a raise feels scarier than negotiating with a stranger. Here's why.

buildup.text: With a new offer, you have leverage: they need you. With a raise, you're renegotiating existing terms.

discovery.text: For raises, build a case over months: document impact, collect praise, track market data.

twist.text: Timing matters enormously. Ask after a big win, during budget season, never during layoffs.

climax.text: Frame it as alignment: 'My role has grown. I'd like my compensation to reflect that.'

punchline.text: Raises aren't given. They're built and then requested.

quiz.question: When is the best time to ask for a raise?
options: After a big win during budget season
